sect1.title: Execution Operators
sect1.para: PHP supports one execution operator: backticks (``). Note that these are not single-quotes! PHP will attempt to execute the contents of the backticks as a shell command; the output will be returned (i.e., it won't simply be dumped to output; it can be assigned to a variable). Use of the backtick operator is identical to shell_exec.

note.para: The backtick operator is disabled when shell_exec is disabled.
Unlike some other languages, backticks have no special meaning within double-quoted strings.
